description: Certificate of lawfulness application (Proposed) for a change of use from hairdressers (A1 Use) to offices (B1 Use) under Part 4, Class D (flexible uses for a two year period) of the General Permitted Development Order (Amendment) (England) Order 2013
decision_conditions: Notwithstanding the details submitted, the applicant is advised that Condition D.2  (a) of Class D, Part 4, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (Amendment) (England) Order 2013 require that a) the developer shall notify the local planning authority of the date the site will begin to be used for one of the flexible uses, and what that use will be, before the use begins; b) at any given time during the two year period referred to in paragraph D the site shall be used for a purpose, or purposes, falling within just one of the use classes comprising the flexible use; c) the site may at any time during the two year period change use to a use falling within one of the other use classes comprising the flexible use, subject to further notification as provided in paragraph (a); d) for the purposes of the Use Classes Order and this Order, during the period of flexible use the site retains the use class it had before changing to any of the flexible uses under Class D; e)the site reverts to its previous lawful use at the end of the period of flexible use.
